oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Weyl and Ricci gauging from the coset construction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Karananas, Georgios K.
Monin, Alexander
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: High Energy Physics - Theory
General Relativity and Quantum Cosmology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper we demonstrate how, using the coset construction, a theory can be systematically made Weyl invariant by gauging the scale symmetry. We show that an analog of the inverse Higgs constraint allows the elimination of the Weyl vector (gauge) field in favor of curvatures. We extend the procedure -- previously coined Ricci gauging -- and discuss its subtlety for the case of theories with higher derivatives of conformally variant fields.
